basics.name: Juan C. Beaver
basics.label: Computer Engineering Student
basics.summary: A highly motivated Computer Engineering student with a strong background in AI, haptic systems, and robotics, fluent in Spanish with extensive research and technical experience.

work.name: Case Western Reserve University
work.summary: Developing and implementing haptic and vision-based systems for surgical and interactive applications.
highlights: Engineered a virtual environment using OpenHaptics and CHAI3D for precise force feedback.
Designed custom Arduino protocols for seamless communication in a haptic system.
Optimized a vision model for surgical force estimation with datasets of over 200,000 images.

work.name: Raytheon Technologies
work.summary: Facilitated learning programs to enhance student engagement and program success.
highlights: Reviewed and tailored content to improve the learning experience.
Developed intervention plans to increase engagement.
Utilized Practera LMS for student progress monitoring and issue resolution.

work.name: FIRST Alumni and Robotics @ CWRU
work.summary: Supporting high school robotics teams in underprivileged communities.
highlights: Mentored students in CAD, programming, and structural design.

work.name: Design For America
work.summary: Led accessible toy development projects for children with cerebral palsy.
highlights: Guided technical aspects of projects using CAD, 3D printing, and laser cutting.
Collaborated with United Cerebral Palsy on accessible toy designs.
Managed a team of 5-7 individuals to ensure high-quality outcomes.

publications.name: Vision-Based Force Estimation for Minimally Invasive Telesurgery Through Contact Detection and Local Stiffness Models
publications.authors: Yang, S., Chua, Z., Golobish, K. R., Beaver, J. C., Le, M. H. H.
